body.p: To his excelency the Honerable Beriah Magoffin Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

your petitioners would State that sometime in 1860 there was a petition addressed to your excelency in behalf of William Grant against whom a fine had been adjudged for Adultry Before David Robinson a Justice of the peace for Pike County which fine had been replevid ^by William Adkins & James L. Ratliff^ and in your clemency you thought proper to grant a respite of twelve months and before the time expired the said William Grant left the Country privately and left his sureties to pay his fines; your petitioners would as you in your Clemency to remit Said fine in as much as the sureties of said Grant have been placed in a condition by the respite Granted to pay the fine when they could other wise have avoided it and your petitioners will ever pray given under our hands this 22nd day of February 1861

David Robinson J P P C
William Adkins
James L Ratliff } sureties
L C Dils
John Dils Jr
Joseph E Ratliff
This is the case in which its parties have left the Country This fine, were I Governor, would be remitted, Trust your excellency will Look at it as I do.

Remitted
B. M
Pike J P
$10. } Adulter
Wm Grant
Issd Mar 28 1861
